Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: JasmineJMK
Reviews.Content: Nice basic but clean room, tea and coffee facilities although when we asked reception for milk they said we could only have one between 4. We traveled as a large group and some friends on the first floor had flies in their room and another group had a cockroach but it wasn't near me so I'm not bothered. Breakfast was tight in a small room and we got a dirty look when I asked for more toast. But I had fun and its what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “poor - but that is London - all you can expect for this price”
Reviews.Author: aniak32
Reviews.Content: small room with typical terrible carpet, old small tv. We spent there a week during strong ;) London's winter (minus 5), and it was quite warm in the room, they also gave us additionally little heater, what was nice. Poor but not terrible cold bathroom with very hot water. Room cleaned daily but "hard" carpet corners left dusty, every day clean white towels, clean sheets, modest tasty breakfast with very well-defined time - fifteen minutes for breakfast must be enough.Staff friendly and helpful. Location - close to Hyde Park, 10 minut's walk to Oxford Street.Quiet and peaceful neighborhood.That is not best place to stay but it is just ok for few days ...My previous experience with hotels in London let me say that for the price is very decent - for London. Ehh, I hate London's "hotels" .

Reviews.Title: “Slightly better than London's Victoria Hotels... I think.”
Reviews.Author: amber1027
Reviews.Content: Ahh London. One of the worlds most beautiful & EXPENSIVE cities! Perhaps the best advice I can give is that you typically get what you pay for in this city. To get what would be your average no thrills hotel in most cities (aside from Tokyo) expect to pay about $200 plus per night. Keeping that and the exchange rate in perspective you can see why these hotels usually get such terrible ratings... that and the fact that they would probably be already have gone out of business in most other cities. Location wise its fantastic. I typically stay in the Victoria area and as my hotel experiences couldn't get much worse than there, I decided to give the Paddington area a try. Paddington Station is a 5-10min walk. Paddington Station is where the Heathrow express arrives (15min journey from Heathrow to Paddington Station for about twenty pounds one way) and the regular Heathrow Train (25min journey for about 9 pounds one way). The walk to the hotel is very simple if you take down directions or a cab fare would probably be about 5 pounds, maybe less. All tube stations seem to be a 5-10 min walk (Paddington or Queensway) and Kennsington Park is a 5 min walk or less. The hotel receptionists were friendly enough and check in was fine. The hotel does provide free and reasonable safe locked luggage storage in a cupboard adjacent to the front desk. You can purchase internet for an hour or a day at the front desk. Think it was around 8-10 pounds for 24hrs. The ensuite room was located in the basement (as most cheaper expedia bookings seem to be) and is a typical tiny London room. The room comes complete with a wardrobe, desk and chair, tv with a few channels (the typical tv remote that apparently works for a tv in some other in the building but not the one in your room) double or twin beds, night stand and barely room to move. The room did come with a small safe and seemed reasonably clean. Bewarned the walls are thin in this hotel! You will hear your neighbors if you have any and they will hear you. On my first morning there I had the pleasure of bring woken up at 530am by a drunken lady screaming into her phone to her mother about helping the children of Egypt after what apparently was a great night out on the town. How do I know all this about a phone conversation having nothing to do with me you ask? As I said the walls are very VERY thin apparently. I am not sure who was more relived when her credit ran out... her mother or myself. I am still not sure if this woman was screaming outside the bedroom door, in the room next door or if she had somehow snuck into my room and was standing with a megaphone at the bottom of my bed. But you get the point. If this woman isn't still around for your 530am wake up call, never fear the many children in the hotel will be up screaming and tearing around the place slamming doors by about 730am. And if this still doesn't rose you out of bed the silent knocking maid with the ability to open a door faster than the speed of light will surely have you up by 10am latest. And yes she did this both days. I was beginning to question if she has a side job with Inquirer to try to get surprise photos. The ensuite bathroom was better than most I have seen in London, even despite the cracked tiles in one area. It apparently had been recently renovated and is refreshingly clean. Plenty of warm water and water pressure. This is not something I am used to in London. Typically I feel like I am attempting a shower out of a frozen garden watering can. So that was a pleasant surprise. Also the shower drain actually drained. Another first in a cheap London hotel for me. Often I emerge from the shower to make my way across a swamp only to find it flooding into my bedroom as well. Do be sure to keep their towels tidy as the sign says or they will happily charge you a 10 pound fee. After the cracked tiles on the floor stained the bathmat towel I had a note awaiting me in my room informing me of a 10 pound charge for replacement. Upon showing the desk clerk that their floor tile was cracked and that is where the stain came from (and that I don't infact wear industrial strength rust on my face as makeup) the charge was dropped. It is a bit comical that they would charge 10 pounds for their towels as even in their brand new towel days I doubt they ever saw 10 pounds. I never tried the hotel breakfast but there is a great little cafe down the same street heading towards Kennsington Park that had a great 4.99 pound traditional English breakfast and other delicious choices as well. So overall location is great, the hotel is better than many I have experienced in Victoria area and just keep in mind you get what you pay for in London and many of the buildings in this city are quite old and cramped which is part of what makes it such a great place and makes finding a descent affordable room so challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Family from Sweden”
Reviews.Author: Sweden33
Reviews.Content: This was the Third time we visit London in a year, and gave this Hotel a second chance in oct 2011, as we wasnt so happy after the first time a year earlier. The first time the whole family of 5 people had to wait nearly an hour for the taxi that the hotel was suposed to send. The kids got a drafty room, from the window, and we, the parents, where every morning woken by the kitchen staff one floor down. Anyway the next time, april 2011, we asked if we could have a specific room, the answer was NO ! = Bad service, so that time we found a good price on a Hilton Hotel and at the same price as this hotel so look around before you decide. In october 2011, we tried again, = BAD idea. The New Mercedes that the Hotel then showed on the homepage as their new Taxi, was instead a old Volkswagen with old papers on the floor, and you guessed right, again we had to wait for it for one hour on Heathrow airport. Got another small room then the one we had before, lucky us :-( , and the bed placed in a room suited for a single bed, was in the form of an old hammock so the back wasnt any happy after the nights. Asked the manager of a refund of the Taxifair, because of the waitingtime that could have taken us in to the hotel by the tube and a lot cheaper, and because of the bad advertising on the class of transport. But the manager since many years couldnt care less and the bad offer he gave isnt worth mention (and we didnt take it as it was more as a big joke) ! So find another Hotel in London, this isnt worth your money!

Reviews.Title: “CUPBOARDS WITH LIMITED BATHROOMS”
Reviews.Author: Wendy A
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room with shared facilities, but was given a cupboard with a window. The first room they gave me was so tiny and claustraphobic, I asked for another, which granted was better as it had a larger window, so didn't feel like a prison cell. The rooms are so tiny, my wardrobe is bigger. In fairness, it was relatively clean, but just not what was advertised. I expected shared facilities to mean sharing with maybe 5 other people, but I found one bathroom with one shower and one toilet between the ground floor, the inbetween ground and 1st (where my room was), the first and second. So even if I had stayed there, it would have been unlikely that I would have been able to wash etc. When I raised my issue with the front desk...no refund, and was told "what did I expect for a 2 star hotel"...well a room not a closet, and reasonable provision of washing facilities actually. I have stayed in hostels on London that are better. In all seriousness, if you can do without a bathroom and can sleep in your wardrobe...go for it...its not cheap for nothing...To be honest, pay a little bit more, and you can get a room and a bathroom...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Katieateapossum
Reviews.Content: For a room this cheap you cant complain. Booked a double room for my partner and i, got upgraded on arrival to a family room as no double rooms left. Room was big enough for us, would probably be a bit tight for family of 4 but you'd fit in! Walls were a bit dank but general cleanliness was ok, typical London standards really. Bathroom was ok, not claridges standards but what you'd expect for Te money paid! Breakfast left a lot to be desired- cold toast, cheese slices and cold hard boiled eggs along with stale cereal and watered down orange- however it's free so can't complain! Over all it's perfect location, good value for money and the staff bend over backwards for you!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel with no hot water and rude staff!!”
Reviews.Author: arry2011
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and i was disapointed to see the hotel lobby and rooms didnt look anything like the photos! The rioms were dirty with stains on the carpet and walls. With shabby bed linen and a well used matress!! The toilet was also filthy! Stayed here for two nights. There was no hot water when showering phoned reception they told me to leave it running for 15 mins, still no sign of hot water, they told me again leave it for 15 mins as there was a problem. 45 mins later still no hot water. Im now late for my meeting. I then complained asking for a full refund as I didn't want to stay the second night. They refused to offer a refund and were extreamly rude and told me to call the police as they are not going to give a refund. After much arguing I gave up and went to my meeting without having a shower. I stayed the second night as I had already payed and didnt receive a refund, hot water problems persisted the second day. Overall I have had a horrible experience with rude staff and wouldn't recommend any one to stay in this hell hole. Pay an extra Â£10 and stay at a decent hotel where u will get clean fresh rooms that have working hot water!!

Reviews.Title: “Will never recommend this hotel. Rooms are dirty. They look nice in pics but are very dirty. Hot water problems as in NO hot wat”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer19789
Reviews.Content: Will never recommend this hotel. Rooms are dirty. They look nice in pics but are very dirty. Hot water problems as in NO hot water at all!

Reviews.Title: “Better options elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions in the past. In the past it was what it was...clean, basic but affordable. It had no pretentions of being anything other than a reasonably priced budget hotel in a decentish location. With a splash of paint in the communal lobby this hotel now believes it is something more than it really is. The room price has also gone up quite considerably with little or any evident improvement in the experience. The staff are pretty surly and unhelpful as well. Certainly there are better, cheaper and more friendlier hotels around to stay at. Wifi is Â£7 a day but wasn't even working in the rooms when I stayed. Will not be returning....ever!

Reviews.Title: “Sentral, quiet but dirty”
Reviews.Author: Anneli V
Reviews.Content: Good for those who is only looking for an ok place to sleep during a stay in London. Easy to travel to, a close tube (actually two!) and a quiet street, which fives you a good night sleep. But the room was dirty, the bath terrible with water leak and an awful smell, the breakfast can't be described (who does the dishes by hand at a hotel in 2011???)... But thanks for making our beds every day and giving us fresh, clean towles!

Reviews.Title: “dont be fooled”
Reviews.Author: john j
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by the entrance of this property. It looks so modern when you come in off the street.The rooms are digusting, the carpet is filty, and the price was ridiculous. The bathroom was cleanish, but towels old and stained. We paid $600 for 4 nights and only stayed for 2, We were given a basement room with the lift next to it, noise from the motor was awful. We were moved, but that room didnt have a fridge, and was just as bad. The location is quite good, but that doesnt make up for the condition of the place. Had two weeks in different hotels every night, most were cheaper than this and 10 times the quality. Very very desappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure Inn, near Paddington”
Reviews.Author: Espen_SPURSY80
Reviews.Content: Good for travelers coming from Heatrow by Heatrow express to Paddington. Short walk or taxi drive. Quiet area. Remember to be out off the room at 11 o'clock or they give you a fine. Short walking distance to a few tube stops: Bayswater, queensway and Paddington. The doors are not soundproof, the toilet badly washed, the carpet looks dirty, small tv with no remote, the water pipes makes a lot of noise during the hole stay, toilet paper roll and towels on top of the toilet(who was not clean!). Breakfast area so small they have to divided it into groups, so we wasn't able to eat. How stands up at 7 for breakfast on a holiday? Not for couples, only for people living cheep to do all their things in London outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff and brilliant location for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: johnyc555
Reviews.Content: my family and i needed a place to stay in central London for a weekend and we thought this was the best all round deal, we were not disappointed. The location is deffinatley the best feature of the hotel, it is very close to Bayswater/Queensway underground stations and there are bus stops at the top of the road. It is also about 5 minutes walk from Hyde Park which was great for the kids as the weather was nice so we visited the park almost every day! The rooms were a reasonable size, clean and well furnished. My wife was worried about the reviews we had read, but it seems that others may have had a bad experience as we saw none of the same issues. The staff were really helpful, the receptionist Eda booked a taxi for us to go to the airport as well as selling us tickets for a bus tour during our stay. The price was also a major factor, its a good deal. Next time we stay in London we're coming back :)

Reviews.Title: “Really run down, old style hotel. Budget blown on entrance!!”
Reviews.Author: samanthalouisehedley
Reviews.Content: I hated this hotel SO much. It didn't take away from the brilliance of London but seriously me and my mam were stuck in a double bedroom aka broom cupboard. Had an ensuite shower..more like en suite closet with a shower head stuck in..you couldn't swing a mouse in it let alone a cat!..you could barely swing a cut in the entire rooms proximity! We were on third floor above stairs..room not really even fit for one person! The decor is SO dated..and that's fine but not for the price the charge...creaky old stairs wake you up everytime someone comes in..shared bathroom was minging..nice warm shower but some blokes must have been on our floor peeing all over the place blurgh!! Breakfast wasnt too bad..could have had a bit more on..some yogurt and cppachino machine or something would have been great but..its passable..but dont stay here..you can get nicer for the same price...seriously if you do stay make sure you ask for a room not over and above the stairs or you'll be stuck in something probably smaller than your fridge!...no lies!!

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: bettic
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews say that this is a horrible hotel. You are paying really cheap rates for a 2* hotel in (nearly) central london what did you expect? However, I enjoyed my stay, the staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms (although small) clean, fairly modern and very comfortable; we had a to use a toilet down the corridoor but we had our own shower. Really not a problem, especially since it clearly stated that that would be the case when we booked. Me and my friend are mid twenties and were just down for a weekend, the area was nice and quiet but literally 2 mins walk from the tube. I will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Just a front to dump you in a tired old hotel”
Reviews.Author: barnum42
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel as it was advertised as having had a recent refit and for a budget hotel was one that had reviews that did not all state "awful, fea-pit or threadbare". I know I'm not getting the Ritz for this price, nor do I expect it. However, after going through the palaver of checking in, I was then given my room number - in a completely different hotel in Notting Hill. Which turned out to be a big threadbare tatty affair. Consequently I can't say what this place is like to stay in, but my suspicion is that it's used to get bookings in then transfer the people to their tatty sister hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: JP_IoW Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Not the cherapest single room with a shared bathroom I've stayed in at Â£42/night. Furnishings are a little old and tired (eg stained carpet) but adequate. Friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing ,travelled 4 london parade.4 2 day trip .”
Reviews.Author: 1bigmomma
Reviews.Content: 1 good point central location, arrived on friday and had booked group in jan for march 43 people with selection of rooms all of these confirmed by the hotel b4 we left only to arrive and they were nt available totaly different to what was booked . we had 3 married couples 1 single which they tried to put in a room that was as small as hot press in ur hse wit no bathroom , and 3 teens not related to any of them ,when we arrived at hotel there was no rooms 4 them and hotel coulnt understand why they coulnt share and why we couldnt put them in quads when we requested doubles .took 2 hrs to check in 43 people and we had to book theese guests in our group without rooms in another hotel ,totally unacceptable and stressful especially with 22 children wit us all tired and hungry ,manager wd nt see us to sort this out and doesnt wrk sundays so earliest was monday when we wd b leaving this says it all .walls are like paper rooms very small even 4 london.never again stayed in hyde park towers last yr totally diffferent experience wd return there again .

Reviews.Title: “DISASTEROUS - NOT JOKING”
Reviews.Author: FRANCES104
Reviews.Content: We are a youth band and booked to stay in this hotel from sat/mon St. Patrick's weekend. We booked this in January but when we arrived they didn't have the rooms that we booked and tried putting us in larger rooms. instead of 8 double they gave us 4 quads. Person on reception wasn't helpful at all just kept saying there was nothing he could do. manager here is very rude as well wouldn't come to the hotel at any point to sort this out. arranged for instruments to be delivered beforehand and they never accepted these either. Rooms are very tiny, nose to nose in twin rooms, not much room to move in triple or quad rooms either. Outside of hotel is very bad, needs a bit of paint. Reception staff or manager not helpful at all. Wouldn't stay at this hotel ever again. Walls are very thin we would hear everything in the room beside us and even under us. Very noisy hotel as well. Even though we had problems with them and I needed to retrieve my e-mails I still had to purchase a token from them to connect to the internet. I wouldn't recommend using this hotel at any time.

Reviews.Title: “BOOKED BUT COULD NOT STAY”
Reviews.Author: mcgonagall
Reviews.Content: Warning: if you book here and pay for it, you might arrive and be transfered to a different, low quality hotel. see Pembridge Palace. this happened to us and if we knew we would be in the pembridge palace we would not have booked. We had booked and paid for a triple room in Leisure Inn, when we arrived, check in staff informed us our room was in another 'sister' hotel, this meant 15 minute walk with luggage and children (one aged 7) through the rain. We were not advised of this prior to arrival, we did have confirmartion of booking via email. The hotel we were transferred to was not up to the standard we were expecting of Leisure Inn after reading its reviews and website. Are waiting for a reply to our complaint.

Reviews.Title: “More like a poor quality youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: Esss_Jay
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the website pictures looked great, and breakfast was thrown in - rare in a budget hotel in London. When we arrived we were greeted by a sign saying "back in 5 minutes" so after a long journey we weren't able to book in straight away. Not a good start. We were eventually given a room........IN THE BASEMENT!! The corridor stank of cheap carpet cleaning powder (remember Shake n Vac?), and the tiny basement room smelled damp. The room was FREEZING and we realised the radiators weren't switched on. We rang Reception and were told that the management had taken the decision to switch the heat off in the basement, so we had a filthy dirty oil heater at the end of the bed instead......literally touching the bed clothes but with no room to move it as it was wedged next to drawers. Talk about a fire hazard! There were also no curtains on the windows! So we went straight back to Reception and asked to change rooms. The Receptionist clearly wasn't happy with this, but we weren't prepared to stay in a cold, damp room in the basement. On the subject of the Receptionist, the words "please" and "thank you" weren't in her vocabulary and she wasn't at all welcoming. We were then given a room on the 2nd floor, which was definitely better than the previous room (though it's all relative - it couldn't have been any worse!) At least we had curtains. However, the tv wouldn't work without a thick black line down the middle of the screen, there was no hot water in the afternoon (so we had to go out in the evening without having had a shower) and the room was still cold. We were told that the heating doesn't come on until 7pm. Just what you need when it's minus 3 outside. The next morning, still no hot water, so we rang Reception again and were told to let the shower run for at least 10 minutes before it gets warm. Yes guys and girls - this is the 21st century but it still takes 10 minutes to get hot water to the 2nd floor in this place. The room had a hairdryer, so I didn't bother taking one with me. However, after just 2 minutes drying my hair the dryer overheated and cut out, and wouldn't work for another 10 minutes until it had reset itself. I wasn't happy using it as I wasn't sure if it was safe, but had no choice as I didn't want to go out in sub-zero temperatures with wet hair. Finally, the breakfast. You have to book your time slot the night before, fair enough we thought as at least we'd get our own table. Wrong!! When we went at our allocated time slot, the very small breakfast room was full and we ended up squeezing on the end of someone else's table. At the area where the food was displayed, there was no milk, no plates and no cutlery. So I had to go to find someone to ask for these items. The orange juice was very weak orange squash. The serving dish containing the cereal I wanted was empty, so I asked for some more but was told they'd run out. Okay, I guess breakfast was a bonus, but I still expected better. On a positive note, while the rooms were very dated and tatty they were clean, and the beds were comfortable. But I would never stay here again.......there was very little to like about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if you really can't afford any better”
Reviews.Author: caerphillytraveller
Reviews.Content: The room was absolutely tiny - that much we expected - but at least the bed was comfy, there was a safe for valuables, and the reception looked nice. Other than that, how much is your comfort worth? If you stay at this place, and if our stay is anything to go by, you can expect any or all of the following: - Ridiculously long wait for hot water - I phoned reception because the shower stayed cold and they told me to leave it running for 5-10 minutes! - Terrible, terrible breakfast in a crowded basement - featuring clattering furniture, lukewarm coffee and the cheapest tinned fruit salad ever. And you have to book a time slot the night before! - An analogue TV (presumably soon to be replaced?) without a working remote. - No reading lights, no shower gel/shampoo, no drinking glasses, no plug in bathroom basin. - Cheap, tacky furniture in the room. - A filthy step leading into the bathroom. - And (beware) a receptionist who ordered us a rip-off minicab - Â£13 to go just around the corner; and he only had a four-seater for the five of us, so we had to pay twice! Turned out the driver actually worked part time on reception! And to think that we missed out on half-price rooms at the Hilton...

Reviews.Title: “Liked it so much we came back for more!”
Reviews.Author: BBBunny25
Reviews.Content: We previously had the fortune of staying at Leisure Inn and liked it so much we are back for more. The value continues to be excellent, the location perfect for a mobile family in London, and the staff friendly. Not the kind of place to entertain guests, but the amenities are plentiful and everything suitable for a base location while on vacation. Highly recommend for a budget-conscious traveller staying in London.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, no frills, but good value and service”
Reviews.Author: pscarf
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, right between three tube stops, this is fairly easy to get to. Breakfast was decent, although not lavish. Neighborhood was quiet. The rooms were small but adequate, clean with kettle for tea in the room. Friendly and helpful staff. Very small lift, but wide stairs. Nice building. Internet in lobby was 1 GBP/15 minutes, which was enough to check e-mail and check-in for flight but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable!!!”
Reviews.Author: dawnWestMids
Reviews.Content: On booking online we read reviews and were really apprehensive about the stay at the hotel and we were having second thoughts about staying in this hotel. However, we went with open mind and was totally amazed to find a clean and pleasant hotel that we had walked into. First impressions was far from what we had been reading on these reviews. We found room 406 very clean and tidy with no 'smells' the hotel in general was quite adequate and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel. Good value of money”
Reviews.Author: HelenAlrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights the last weekend of september. We had booked a 4 people room, because it was cheaper, and we only wanted to rest there. The room had 4 single bed, a wardrobe with hangers, a TV, a fridge (very useful if you like to save money eating sandwiches) and tea and coffe facilities (good if it is cold outside) The heating was so good that it was even really warm in the room, but nice. About the breakfast: toasts, boiled eggs, cheese, all kind of jams... Really nice, and never busy as you can choose the time you want to have breakfast the day before. IÂ´d really recommend it! its 20 minutes walk from Marble arch, and 5 minutes from Bayswater and Queesway Stations. If you arrive late, they have their own taxi company. For exmaple, from Marble arch to the hotel 15 pounds by car (lovely Mercedes!) By bus for 4 people would have been 8, but at 3 oÂ´clock in the morning... I found it a very good service.

Reviews.Title: “The room smelled of Smelly Feet INCLUDING the bedsheets.”
Reviews.Author: leila221984
Reviews.Content: The room itself is tiny, no room for suitcases. The beds are directly next to each other with hardly any space between them. If space isn't an issue for you then maybe the stale stench of the room which I associated with extremely stinky feet might be a fundamental issue for you. I woke up several times during the night because of this overwhelming smell. However if these things do not bother you, it is in a fantastic location this is the only positive aspect of this 'hotel'.

Reviews.Title: “Apalling, what a joke !!!”
Reviews.Author: suzy1970_10
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgusting, the staff, rooms and cleaning service was the worse i have ever experienced, felt like we were staying in a refuge shelter, unhelpful and unapproachable staff, filthy rooms, the next day our beds were made and nothing else, rooms were not hoovered and our dirty coffee cups were left behind,,,,,, really shabby

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: abaker64
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel disgusting badly in need of a good clean and decorating children refused to eat breakfast it was so bad.would not stay there if paid to do so.Only good point was staff were very nice.only stayed the one night and that was more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel with poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: UniversalTraveller17
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. The bedding looked like it had not been changed and had what I could only describe as white body fluids on it. Generally dirty. Utterly appalled and the staff were completely unhelpful, uninterested and displayed no customer service. Breakfast was poor with very limited selection and I ended up chosing a cheap brand of corn flakes.

Reviews.Title: “Negative for extremely tight rooms, positive for location”
Reviews.Author: Gnammy
Reviews.Content: Rooms: negative experience. Location: very good. Room 305 is extremely tight, derived from staircase room, almost claustrophobic. Bed is slightly more than single. No wardrobe (only three hooks). We asked to change room and were given room 404, just slightly better but toilet even smaller. Considering the price, rooms should be much better.Renewing is needed. Safebox and lift was the only positive part, together with location, about 5 minutes walk to Queensway and 8 minutes from Bayswater tube station. Breakfast was acceptable: cereals, bread, jam, honey, tea, coffee, industrial fruit salad.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: ripleytrain
Reviews.Content: First impressions from the website and front reception - great. It went down hill when I left the reception to go to the room. In need of a good paint was the first impressions before getting to the room. Room was small but adequate. Bed had collapsed on one side so spent most of the night trying not to fall out of the double bed. Noise from next door at 4 am didn't help! Sink had no plug so not much use to someone who has a wet shave - managed just. Breakfast was toast and cereals - adequate but what happened to a offer of a full English Breakfast ? Maybe I ask for too much ...

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL, (DISGUSTING)”
Reviews.Author: todd27
Reviews.Content: this hotel is disgusting and the service is terrible the staff dont give a [--]. when we booked this hotel through lastminute it showed some really nice pics of the hotel we got a shock when we arrived, the room we got given was so small and dirty it was unreal i woulnt keep my pet rat in that hotel, when we tried to complain the staff just said there was no manager to speak to. absolute shocking service this hotel wants shutting down!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss. Should be gutted and start again.”
Reviews.Author: HowardPH
Reviews.Content: No booking recorded on arrival. Room too small for 3 people. No room for luggage. Bathroom is built into the room dimension. Ceiling lights flicker with an electrical shortage in the switch. No hot water in the morning. Minimal water pressure. Hot and no ventilation. Room renovated maybe 10 years ago with tacky furniture and carpet now well worn. Floor uneven so furniture all standing at an angle. Toilet cistern takes 40 minutes to re-fill. Minimal English spoken by morning staff. Breakfast not available until after 7:30am. No internet available as the vouchers were all sold. An over-rated back-packer lodge. Moved out after one night, and argued with the owner about paying for the full week booking, which magically appeared when we disputed. What a way to spoil a week in London, if we had to return to this dump every night. Maybe worth GBP15 per person, so at best for 3 people no more than GBP50. Our charge at rack rate was GBP190. We couldn't escape fast enough.We moved down the road to Lancaster Hotel, and for GBP8 more, we had a huge modern American-style four-star hotel with sweeping views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “So bad I was expecting Basil Fawlty to appear”
Reviews.Author: Debbieuk78
Reviews.Content: After hearing about the dreaded room 308, we were relieved to be handed room 11. Oh how that feeling evaporated quickly when we realised we were: a) in the basement, b) next to the "dining room" and c) had a view of a white brick wall and the kitchen. The staff were obviously minimum wage and unpleased with their chosen job, which extended equally to the "dining staff". Breakfast was laughingly funny and when my partner asked if more eggs would be available, a curt no was given. Never heard of breakfast not being served all the way through the alloted time - and along with the toast was the only thing they were actually cooking!!! The bathroom was so small I could comfortably wash myself whilst sat on the toilet. The promise of sky television led us to crying out with laughter. After fiddling with the aerial we managed 7 channels, 2 of which were the same and one appeared to be of persian descent. The walls were so thin we could hear next door turn on their fan and the staff arrive for breakfast! After all this, the final laugh was provided when we asked to store our luggage in the luggage "room" which turned out to be a cupboard which ironically was bigger than our bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Better service in the Tube station. do NOT stay”
Reviews.Author: travellerAk2NZ
Reviews.Content: I had the room booked for two nights for my girlfriend and myself. We had been staying at different hotels throughout London. I'm a Hilton VIP so I had a couple free nights at a few of their locations and then at 274 suites. I spent nearly 2 hours travelling and getting lost trying to find this horrible hotel. I say horrible not because of the amenities etc, but because of the service and rudeness of the staff. They said they couldn't find my reservation, which I had just made the night before, and which i had received an email confirmation, so i asked if I could use the internet, they made me pay for 15 minutes when i only needed it for two because they could find my reservation. I asked them if i could just have a code as this was all a miscommunication and the receptionist says to me "well if I gave that to you for free I''d have to take it out of my pay cheque and they don't pay me enough to do that for you. doesn't that seem a little big of you to ask." so finally after she stared me down I paid and got online, found my confirmation and they pulled out a piece of paper and said it was for last night and tonight and that they had cancelled the reservaation, I showed them that I had BOOKED it last night but that it wasnt until this night, and they said sorry they dont have any rooms available tonight. There was a lot more that they did, that I'm honestly too tired of them to give them any more thought. It was raining outside and they didn't even have the decency to call a few places in the area for us and told us to "go look yourselves." I believe in hospitality and working for the clients, cause without us they wouldn't have a job. I would give this location a 0 if I could. DON'T STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: piglet
Reviews.Content: This is good budget hotel in an excellent location. Yes, the rooms are small but it is clean and serves the purpose for a short stay. The double bed was comfortable and the towels clean; there was even a hairdryer and tea and coffee making facilities. The breakfast is basic but sufficient, consisting of tea, coffee, squash (not real juice), tinned fruit, boiled eggs, cheese and toast. There is a lift which you often don't see in such hotels so that's handy too. For what we paid it was good value for money and I woudl definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, large room for the price”
Reviews.Author: steedyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here once before, and this time it was just as nice, if not better. The room was clean, the beds were nice, breakfast was fine. overall, for the price, which was less than Â£50 a room, it was great. The location is good as well, as it's so close to the circle line, where most things are. The only bad thing was that i though the batheroom was tiny.

Reviews.Title: “It's completely fine”
Reviews.Author: mothercuttle
Reviews.Content: I was abit worried about this hotel because of some other reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. It's comfortable, the room is a fine size, the towels are changed every day, and it's in an excellent location, very close to Bayswater and the tube station. There are a couple of small things, but that would just be pedantic. I have felt safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Our showering skills were questioned when we told we were from...”
Reviews.Author: ZfromI
Reviews.Content: Freezing cold (no insulation), smallest room ever. Hot water for only a few minutes than it stops. The shower practically showered into the bathroom floor. When asked to change the room explaining our difficulties we were asked where we were from. When we said from Istanbul, we were given a lecture on how to take a shower, in order to stop it from going on to the bathroom floor! So no changing rooms!!! Thanks to our lucky stars the receptionist in the morning was Turkish and she helped us and changed our room. Much larger, no bad shower and warmer than the other. But the hotel is very central, due to insulation it should be preferred for travelling in warmer seasons. The beds were comfy and room was clean. But the staff (including the receptionist) is in desperate need of a communication skills seminar. Our door was knocked for cleaning in the morning since there are no "do not disturb signs", we said we were in the room. In the next 30 mins. the door was probably knocked 10 times if not 15!!!

Reviews.Title: “worn out”
Reviews.Author: pikeHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Location is fine. Roomas are cleaned everyday.But the room for three persons was terrible worn out and such a dirtyness that can`t be cleaned. Lamps were not working, hair dryer was dangerous etc.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cuthillb
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but clean, modern and everything worked well. Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilShropshireLad
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid it was good value for money, the rooms were clean and cleaned each day.The location is excellent for sight seeing of London

Reviews.Title: “Worked out great!”
Reviews.Author: thehabibs
Reviews.Content: Our other accomodations had fallen through and Leisure Inn fit us in at the last minute. Very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Husband and I like this hotel - we always stay here when we visit London”
Reviews.Author: louiselo
Reviews.Content: The Leisure Inn is in a great location - near Hyde park, tube. transport, etc. It's my first choice when we stay in London. Okay, the rooms are small, the bathroom teeny, the decor a little shabby, but we always manage to get bargain prices, and we enjoy our stay - the breakfast is decent, and everything is satisfactory and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs- there's Budget and there's Budget”
Reviews.Author: Tartanteaser
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel scruffy and quite dirty. There was no air conditioning and the window in our room didn't open. As we had four adults in a quad room it was far too hot. We aked for a fan but were told there was none available so we were offered another room with a balcony. This was equally dirty and 'tired' but thankfully the window opened to allow some air. The following morning we woke to find the room was plagued with ants (YUCK).We found only two of the staff were helpful and few spoke English. The 'continental breakfast' was very basic to say the least. On the up-side the area is very nice and we would definately stay again in this part of the city however when we next visit It will be worth paying a few pounds more and staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but all the rest ...”
Reviews.Author: Impressia
Reviews.Content: I will remember this hotel for a long time. We stayed in the room for 4 people. The first room we stayed was a bit small, but OK ( as we first thought) On the second night of our stay a little accident happened : probably someone who lived upstaires dropped smth heavy on the floor and that something made a lot of noise and ... 2 holes in our rooms's ceiling. it was pretty scary . So, they moved us to the other room ( 3rd floor) : the other room was a bit smaller, than the first one and the water pressure was really bad. When we asked to fix it - got the answer - that it is not possible. The lights were also acting weird - they were going out in 15-20 minutes, so we had to switch them off for approximately the same time to get the light again. Well, the location of the hotel is really good :)

Reviews.Title: “The rough surrounded by diamonds”
Reviews.Author: jamesmoon1986
Reviews.Content: AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Nothing good to say about this place, the worst hotel I have ever stayed in during my time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, very clean and 'very' central”
Reviews.Author: BucharestAndreea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only one night as I moved then with some local friends. But I was very surprised in a good way by the night I spent there. Small room, yes, but very clean, with comfortable beds. The street and the area is very quite.The bathroom was small but ok. Breakfast not bad but scarce. Tea, coffee, cheese, ham, boiled eggs, some jam and honey. The location was great, near 3 different subway stations. Overall - for those travelers who just need a room to sleep in - is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thedeeg
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t stress this enough, this is a BUDGET hotel. Iâ€™ve paid between Â£20 and Â£49 p/night to stay there, and have stayed there half a dozen times. To sum up all of those stays: Positives: Every time I have stayed there, the rooms have been clean, tired yes, in need of a renovation yes, but clean none the less. Every time I have stayed there, I have had hot water for a shower between 7AM and 9AM, the showers have always been clean with good water pressure. 24 Hour reception, I have checked in between 1700 and 0400, and there has always been someone to check me in. 5 minutes walk to Paddington station. Negatives: The rooms are small and tired, however, they are no smaller than rooms in some of the large chain hotels in the area where you will pay anything up to Â£200 p/night. I have read the reviews on here, and I donâ€™t understand it, maybe my expectations are much lower than everyone else when paying as little as Â£20 p/night for a double en-suite room in central London, but Iâ€™ve never had a dirty room, and Iâ€™ve always been able to get a hot shower in the morning, which is enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: happycampet
Reviews.Content: Both myself and my partner stayed here for two nights on a budget trip to London. We didn't expect the Ritz or the Hilton but we did expect some hot water! Our first impression of a double en-suite room was incredibly small and very shabby! I have never seen a hotel room with a door that has an inch gap underneath! So not only can you hear people walking past you can actually see them too! We only planned to use the room as a place to get a HOT shower and for somewhere for us to sleep. Our first night went ok but in the morning at about 8am we tried to get a nice hot shower to find there was no hot water! When I rang the reception desk to enquire what was happening I got no help and was simply told to complain to the manager. When I asked what time he would be about they said they didn't know as he comes and goes! So with a day in London planned (which was covered in snow!) and a freezing cold shower later we headed down to the restaurant for our breakfast to be told "we have run out"!!! So overall, I accept this is a budget hotel but would rather have stayed in a Hostel! No way would I stay here again and i would never recommend this hotel to anybody!!! take my advice and STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sets the standard for budget hotels in London”
Reviews.Author: Westy666
Reviews.Content: A real gem - and the rarest of things - a genuine bargain in central London. OK - so I got a 'credit crunch' bargain price in the middle of January, but even if I'd paid 3- 4X what I did, there would have been no complaints. Having booked a double room, I got a huge (for London) 4-berth room (double and two single beds). The room was spotless, the linen clean and fresh and enough little touches (recessed spotlights/pictures and mirrors/a small fridge/tea & coffee facilites) to make it feel like a higher star rated room. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in and although the bathroom was small (1metre by 3metres), it was also spotless, nicely tiled and the shower was hot and powerful. Not only that - the television has a decent selection of channels and a remote control that actually worked. A miracle. Breakfast was included in the knockdown price - basic but the toast was freshly made on arrival, and the staff were friendly and helpful. In short - this hotel is EVERYTHING that a budget hotel should be; not flashy but the basics done well. Many so called 'trendy' boutique hotels that charge rip-off prices offer far less for much, much more.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: johnk146
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired and ready for a ggod nights sleep. At first appearance this place looks great. After sorting out a booking hassle. We asked if we wanted to upgrade. I thought the picture of the room on the net looked great so I declined they asked for a 20 pound deposit on the key!!. We had rm 10. We made our way downstairs along a corridor to our room. It was no larger than a cupboard. The bed must have been built in the room because you would have to smash it up to get it out. Something I would glaadly do. WE did however have a sink. The bathroom was another thing it was two corridors away. You had to step up from the corridor. You couldnt turn in it without opening the door. It was abismal!! Not to mention the herd of antelope that ran around the corridors at night slamming doors! We left very early! O and don't forget ask for your for your 20 pound back if you mistakenly book a room here; because they didn't offer it to me. I had to ask they just said thanks for the key and goodbye!! Beware of room 10 and maybe some other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot in the city”
Reviews.Author: bruthedog
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was looking for. Great spot for a clean and friendly place to rest at night. Desk clerks polite and helpful. Hotel was close to train station to get into city. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Caz2008
Reviews.Content: Our friend booked this room for us via another site, laterooms.com. It was very last minute so according to that website the room we got usually goes for 300 pounds and we got it for 85 pounds. The receptionists were friendly, the room was small with 3 single beds and a small bathroom but it was all very clean . There was a tiny hanging area, a small tv and tea and coffee making facilities which I thought was a nice touch. Continental breakfast was included which was quite good (toast, cereal, boiled eggs, coffee and juice etc). They have a pay as you go internet kiosk in reception. It was conveniently located, easy walking distance to Bayswater Station and lots of convenience stores (SPAR, Tescos) as well as Boots, Superdrug, a post office and lots of places to eat and a couple of pubs. Having stayed at Lords Hotel which is on the other side of the tube station I would prefer this place (see my other review) for the price. I've read the other reviews of this place and am surprised as I don't have anything to complain about so I guess we lucked out!

Reviews.Title: “when will I learn !!!”
Reviews.Author: swas
Reviews.Content: Undoubdetdly the worst B&B/hotel I have ever stayed in. Yes it is cheap for London @Â£45 for a single room but for a few Â£'s more you can get basic, clean, ensuite with cooked breakfast in the same locale'. On arrival I was offered a tiny room with the bed and matress turned over "for fumigation". The next room I was offered appeared to be a converted store room. Small, uncomfortable bed ,broken blinds covering a draughty old window. Not even a sink in the room:-the toilet/bathroom facilities are shared but they are tiny facilities shared amongst a large number of guests. Get there after 7.30 a.m and all the hot water has run out. Breakfast not cooked and a somewhat limited "continental" on offer instead. Don't be fooled by the swish looking reception area. This is one step removed from a homeless shelter.!!

Reviews.Title: “if you like cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: batiger
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches in room. Had to leave at 1:30 a.m. because hotel was booked and received no help from the staff in getting other accomodations. Still awaiting refund from All-Hotels, who booked us in this hotel. Suggest avoiding this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we could imagine!”
Reviews.Author: Zannet
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to find out that the hotel was really close (4 min. walk) to the Bayswater station(we were really close to the center of London)! as we had booked a room for three and the hotel was perhaps not avaliable or didn't really have any room for 3 persons in the same building, we were transfered by taxi(they paid for it) one block away from the hotel(even closer to the station!) in a private appartment and breakfast was still served in the hotel( they are very stricked about the time the breakfast closes- so be careful not to be late)! it had plenty of room, three beds, heat radiator, kitchen, washing machine everything! The problems were: it was underground... no view and it was a little bit scary but the neighbour next door was very friendly and was allways there so we were kind of reliefed! Also we had a little issue with the door sometimes we couldn't unlock it (thanks to the neighbour we managed it!) The toilet was small (not too small) but very clean! We were afraid of how the hotel will be but this was beyond our expectations... PS. the receptionists were very polite and helpfull!! the hotel also has a luggage room where you can leave chargefree your luggage safely and it is 24 hours open- we had a really late flight and it was extremely helpfull!

Reviews.Title: “4 Rooms in 2 Days!”
Reviews.Author: tashandbradworldwide
Reviews.Content: So, we arrived after booking online for a double room with double bed for two nights and we checked in and went up to our room to find 3 single beds in a room. Okay, their mistake so we headed down to reception and they changed us to another room. This time the room had a double bed and two singles, hrmm, a little unnecessary for two people but okay. However, the wall had a MASSIVE, and I'm talking MASSIVE, amount of water damage on the wall. Laughably, they had a crooked painting trying to cover the large hole in the wall but the damage went from the middle of the wall to the roof. By this time we were too tired to complain so we just went to bed, but a small child cried from 3am til 9am when we went for breakfast (admittedly not the hotel's fault but annoying nonetheless). Breakfast was pretty standard, toast, cereals, juice and perfect for the budget traveller looking to get some grub in before they start their day. After breakfast we asked to have our room changed because of the water damage and annoying kid and they gave yet another room. Open the door, and BAM, 4 single beds. Why 4 singles for a couple? Asked for a double bed room as we'd asked for when we booked and were told one wasn't available til 1pm so we went off for the day. Finally at 1pm we got a room with one double bed and it was pretty perfect for what we need. Overall, this hotel was pretty good for budget travellers (although at Â£97 for two nights we've paid a lot less) looking for somewhere close to good restaurants and tube stations but not all rooms are great (we got to sample 4). Buyer beware, be specific when you check in that ask for what you want bedwise or you may get shafted.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: KEJ2
Reviews.Content: I have just checked "excellent" for our overall experience; of course, we were in London, so how could it not be excellent. I would give the hotel three and a half stars if I were comparing it to some places in the US. There were five of us travelling, so we had two rooms: a triple and a double. Of course the rooms are small, but in Europe, that is normal. And of course, there was a bit of mold on the shower tiles, but nothing to bother a seasoned traveller. The mattresses were good, the sheets were clean, the breakfast was great: hard boiled eggs, muesli or cornflakes, toast, cheese and coffee, tea and juice. That breakfast kept us going all day. And the location is very good: situated in Bayswater, a bustling residential area with some good local pubs in the neighborhood and only a few tube stops (on the circle line ) from central London. There is internet access in the lobby (one computer), a little expensive at one pound for fifteen minutes, but there are internet cafes around if you want more time. The front desk staff are quite helpful. If you are expecting the Ritz--this is not the place for you, but if you are travelling on a budget and looking for good value for your money, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: cursivefan
Reviews.Content: My standards are different because I am from the US and I am used to decent hotels. Because the exchange rate is poor for Americans traveling here, hotels in London are expensive. You can get a 4 star hotel in the US for the same price as this one. The rooms were clean and small but that wasn't too bad. Because they are cheap though their are a lot of younger people and this makes for a loud night. Also the water was difficult to control and you had to adjust the knob just right to get hot water. There was a heater in the room but you could not control. This location is decent you can get anywhere from here. The beds are not great, very hard like a piece of cardboard on concrete.

Reviews.Title: “good weekend”
Reviews.Author: saleandr
Reviews.Content: clean,cheap

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price - and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: orientfan16
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel at last minute, as I arrived in London to do some shopping before going home to Devon. I booked the hotel via the internet, using one off the internet pay phones at waterloo station. After booking, i made my way straight over to the hotel. I had already stayed at this hotel twice before, so i knew what to expect. The hotel is minutes away from Bayswater and Queensway tube (although i always use Bayswater tube - its much quicker to exit!). I arrived at the hotel, and was checked in quickly by the receptionist - as ive mentioned ive been here before and i remembered this receptionist is the rude one - always looking unhappy and depressed!! I made my way up to my room, it was the second time i had the same room and was very pleased about it. The room is very clean, good bed, decent sized tv, 6 tv channels, and plenty of space compared to other London hotels. The room was very warm, and I had a good view overlooking the Queensway area. The bathroom is very clean - and a good size. The shower was always warm, and I had no problems. The hotel is near a mini Tesco, Mcdonalds, Burger King and small independant shops. (They are on the Queensway high street - all opposite Baywater tube) I went downstairs at 11am to get some more tea bags, and was greeted by the friendly bloke at reception. He spoke to me for 10 minutes, and seemed very good at his job. I went out about an hour later, and again the receptionist was very friendly. I woke up at 5.30am, and went for a run in the local area - i love that part off london in early morning - see all the workers going about their normal day. The hotel is very near to Paddington Train station, and not too far from Oxford Street. About an hour later, i arrived back to a nice warm hotel. The hotel is very quiet - almost no traffic noise, and i never hear guests going past the room. The downside about the hotel is the breakfast - its terrible!! I recieved an egg, one slice off toast, and a cold cup of tea! It was the first time i tried breakfast at this hotel - i thought the decor off the room was poor as well. My tip is go to Mcdonalds for a egg mcmuffin - it opens at 6am and is only Â£1. Or Tesco do decent sandwiches, or get a Cereal bowl from 50p with cereal and milk included! I paid Â£35 for my en-suite room, a bargain!! It said in the reception normal room rates are Â£70, the most ive ever paid here is Â£40 a night, and I would not pay over that here. So if you can get a good rate, stay here, if not there are plenty off good hotels in london at fair prices.

Reviews.Title: “thank you leisure!!”
Reviews.Author: leonardo75
Reviews.Content: leisure inn is fantasticly central ... i liked it for a budget hotel....in a big town is all you would like to have... zoya is very helpfull thanks leo

Reviews.Title: “if you can put a bit more money , avoid”
Reviews.Author: LOUGIR
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights there .. we booked by the internet after reading the reviews on T.A. ; so we knew that the advices were 'shared' .. some were good, some bad . We choosed this place because of the price , its good location and... they had vacancies for our dates when we booked !! (it was clearly not our first choice) . London is VERY expensive; everything is expensive there , especially the hotels; we payed around 100 pounds/night ; for that price in Paris you can hope a rather good hotel , not luxuous, but comfortable and well located. The room we had was tiny , so tiny : smaller, you have to walk on the walls , Spiderman wellcome ! So tiny was the bathroom , that i had to keep the door open , to be able to move and dry myself with the towel ! A good revamping would be appreciated for the room , but it was clean and the towels changed everyday . If the room was cleaned everyday , it was not the same for the corridors . The hotel is located in a good area , quiet , but with several shops and restaurants around , close to Kensington garden. Good and fast links with the center by tube and bus. Something we didn't appreciate at all : we booked an 'en suite' room .. and when we went in the room : no toilets !! i complained at the lobby , and they said : yes , we are very sorry , there was probably a problem with the online booking , we have no more en suite rooms for tonight ! i protested and finally they gave me a room with toilets , saying : some didn't check in yet , we give you the room ! What a behaviour !! they perfectly knew i hadn't the room i booked but they didn't say anything about it : no apologizes, no adjustment of the price ! . I wonder what happened with the people who booked the room we finally got ! In conclusion : perhaps an acceptable choice if the price is your main criteria (still, compare with same priced hotels ot B&B) ; if you can put a bit more money , avoid !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent at the price”
Reviews.Author: foto-turist
Reviews.Content: We were 3, and the room was not big, but we were in London to see the town, not staying in the room. Stayed there for 1 week. Everything in the room was proper, in a good state, especially the bathroom - that was really nice. Breakfast good and plenty, again compared to price. Staff always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Clean Central but Small”
Reviews.Author: RogerMambo
Reviews.Content: I was a single traveler who book a single room, which meant it's a shared washroom and shower. The show was inconveniently located in the basement so if you had share shower, you'll have to wash and dash and hope no one sees you. The room I got was very small but for the price it's spot on. The room is only the size of a King bed which is a bit of a shock for North Americans but if you are spending most of your time roaming around the city, you probably just be back sleeping. Over all, great value for the small room, just make sure to bring a pallet gun for the noisy doves.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!!!”
Reviews.Author: diipadaapa
Reviews.Content: We made the reservation here mainly because it was the only hotel, where we got two family rooms (quad-en-suites). However, the rooms were very different in size. Ours was very small, so we practically had to throw ourselves on the bed straight from the door :-) . Our room was on the 3rd floor, we had only lukewarm dripping water (no pressure, that is), no hooks in the bathroom (or bathcloset, as it was so tiny, that if you sat on the toilet, the sink was on your lap...) or anywhere else, either. So we had towels and clothes everywhere. Otherwise, the room was clean and warm. Our friends on the other hand, stayed in a much bigger room (though it was the same priced), but it was really cold at night. They asked for extra blankets, but never got them (actually the one, that was already there, was taken away after their request to get more...), neither was their radiator checked. The staff didn't even bother to seem interested. Breakfast room was too small. Breakfast itself - well, what can I say. It was always the same: toast, jam, butter, cheese, cereal, milk, fruit salad from straight the can, orange juice, tea/coffee. Being used to have something fresh (veggies or fruit) and dark rye bread this was really tough. The location of the hotel is good, peaceful and close enough to the tube and bus stop. I could go there again, if the price was cheaper, but with these prices I expect warm water and a little service!

Reviews.Title: “Disapponting, poor service”
Reviews.Author: starly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was much more modest, to say the least, than advertised, with extremely small rooms and bathrooms, an odd smell throughout, and overpriced. But the real concern was a rude staff member on the evening shift at the reception desk. This young man was condescending, dismissive, disrespectful, and reluctant to respond to requests in anything like an efficient manner. I found this to be the case not once, but at each of the three interactions I had with him. Daytime staff was a bit better, but one--when we asked him to call a taxi--summoned a driver who he clearly knew personally and who was clearly not a legal cab driver. The overall feeling I came away with was very uncomfortable, disappointed, and uneasy. Will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mammaLondon
Reviews.Content: OK hotel, walking distance to Oxford Street. Breakfast ok for the price. Room ok. Cleaning excellent. Reception staff nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: melissann15
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good option for a cheap, quick stay, but beyond that, does not offer anything spectacular. I came in late Sunday night, and left Monday morning. Everything was average. It was a big hassle to carry my 30 kilo suitcase up 3 flights of stairs though!! (the elevator was broken). Breakfast is only served 7:30 to 9:30 am, which can be difficult if you want to sleep in. The room was relatively clean, but had a strange smell and was extremely hot as the windows could only be cracked. Overall, it's good to go and get out, but I'm sure there are better, cheap options in London that have a bit more charm.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Robbis
Reviews.Content: For the money this is rather god! Good value for the money and breakfast included to! Rather central as well Robbis

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosaDay
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on 'lastminute.com' - and it was really at the last minute for me... I arrived to a warm welcome by the reception staff. I was early but the room was available. The room I had was a single en suite, very small, but it had all that was expected. No air conditioning, so reached 26deg overnight. Limited in the TV channels, so didn't see what I wanted at all. Continental breakfast OK and in pleasant room. Hotel in a quiet area, but also close to basic shopping - restaurants - and to the underground transport. I would come again and would also recommend it to others. (Female - over 60)

Reviews.Title: “Ana (Portugal)”
Reviews.Author: visitorLondon_9
Reviews.Content: Do the pictures on the web site don't reflecte the bedroom we staid in, you have fresh towels and a clean room every day. the staff is ok, always at your disposal. after knowing the city (expensive!) it is a good offer for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Service is not excellent”
Reviews.Author: plidderpladder
Reviews.Content: We must say, that our stay at the Leisure Inn was combined with several problems: No hot water in the bathrooms several times. A lamp that didn`t work We wanted an extra pillow, which we didn`t get until the next day. The bathroom was very, very small. If you want to eat breakfast after 8 in the morning, you`ll have to wait in a line. The breakfast is not anything to write home about. A hardboiled, cold egg, terrible coffee and cold toast. Some cereal. And thats all. The good thing is, that the hotel is relatively close to a subway.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: PlasticCastle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the Bayswater area and close to the Queensway tube and Hyde Park. You can find Italian, Chinese, Greek and Malaysian restaurants nearby. Also quite a number of internet cafÃ©s and night shops. Iâ€™m usually not all that bothered by the size of my hotel room (you just sleep there right?) but I was quite annoyed to find out the room was actually a single room with an extra bed. We booked a twin room. The bathroom was quite spacious but two mornings in a row we were greeted by creepy crawlies in the bathtub. After breakfast we spotted a larger version of the insect in the hallway. Breakfast (served between 7.30 and 9.30) itself was okay, but nothing special. No buns or fruit, just some toast. If youâ€™re a big eater, you could leave still hungry. When leaving the hotel we informed if we could store our luggage for the afternoon. There is a storeroom but the staff behind the reception couldnâ€™t find the key! Well, they really didnâ€™t bother looking. They suggested we put our luggage by the reception unsupervised. When we declined they made a sneer at us. Just imagine you have to catch a flight and the damn key is nowhere to be found! To be on the safe side we stored our luggage in Waterloo Station. My conclusion: unfortunately the negative outweighs the positive. I will not be staying here again. Also, I wouldnâ€™t recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “On a scale of one to ten, it's a five”
Reviews.Author: lostinthe
Reviews.Content: Because this hotel was recently rennovated, everything may look good at first. However, at second glance, it appears as though the hotel is gilded, as they try to make it look better than it is. In the rooms, the carpets look nice, but they have stains. The bathrooms look great from afar, but up close one can see cracks in the mirror and the flaws in such a small sized bathroom. All the problems would be excusable, if the room rates were not so high and the hotel weren't so far from paddington station or any tube station. Also, costs of access to a computer if a traveler didn't bring one increases as the minutes go by, and the only way to earn free usage is to write a hotel review such as this one. This hotel is recommended as long as the traveller knows exactly where it is.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but better exists”
Reviews.Author: ntrgc89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my brother for 5 days in late june and found the hotel to have decent accomodations, but there were a few points that were fairly bothersome. i would advise people who stay here to avoid room 14; it is right next to the washer and dryer the hotel uses for towels and linens etc. which is working fairly constantly during the morning, and at strange times at night making it difficult to sleep. also, the only ventilation was two windows which opened out onto a staff walkway so the staff would constantly close them whenever they walk by. the hot water in the shower was finnicky, while never actually getting cold it would sometimes stay lukewarm. but the hotel does have some redeeming factos. it is right next to queensway which is a great place for eating a some light shopping, as well as 2 metro stations. the staff are friendly and helpful. that pretty much sums it up i think. mostly the hotel is fine if you plan to spend the better part of your day going about London.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - mould and water everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Around_the_World65
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. I had booked a family room 2 months before our arrival and expected a nice room. We, a family with two teenagers, were given room #7 which was on ground floor. Already in the hallway we felt an unpleasant smell and it didn't get more pleasant when we realised that it came from our room. When we entered I stepped on something "splashy" - that was our carpet. It was soaking wet from the water that came running down directly from the bathroom above. The ceiling was cracking, the wallpaper was coming down and the stench of mould was revolting. I went right back to the reception where a gum-chewing girl said that they were fully booked and that she could do nothing at the moment. As it was almost midnight and we were all really tired we opened the window (in mid-November) and tried to sleep in that hell-hole anyway. By 6am I was nearly suffocating and I ran out to the reception in my nightwear and demanded another room immediately or else I would have to go to hospital for my asthma. She turned pale and assured me we get another room in the afternoon. When we came back in the afternoon we were given another room which was OK, but my not wanting to pay for the first night was neglected (I had paid everything in advance, stupid) and they even had the nerve to tell me I should be grateful that they gave us another room. Well back home I sent an e-mail to the Hotel Manager, to Travelocity and to the UK Tourist Board. Nobody ever answered or even acknowledged my mail. Stay away from Leisure Inn, it's as far from leisure as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: emmalm
Reviews.Content: As we booked in we were told the hotel was over booked and we would be staying in a 'nice apartment' just a few minutes away. We were treated very well, a taxi was ordered and paid for and we were dropped at the apartment. The bedsit/tiny flat was on the 3rd floor and there was no lift, so it was a bit of a trek with suitcases. The flat itself was disgusting, it was filthy, the bed covers were dirty, but someone had kindly sprayed them with deodorant to make them smell ok. The kitchenette smelt of sick and this was probably coming from the fridge, which was leaking, and had a dirty towel shoved in the base of it to stop the icebox melting. Every upholstered surface was covered in fluff and long white hairs, the shower room was dirty and the shower itself had brown water in the base unit. Additionally there were no fire or emergency evacuation instructions, I'm not a risk freak, but in an enormous block of flats such as this one, itâ€™s always nice to know how to get out! The flat itself was in a square just off Queensway, unfortunately it looks as if this square is on the wrong side of the tracks as on every doorstep, there were drunks or people waiting to collect a fix. I wouldn't have felt safe walking back to the flat on my own; luckily I had a big strong man with me! We had to stay one night in this flat, but I complained the next morning and while the manager on duty was fairly nonchalant and didn't offer an apology they did put us in a room in the hotel - room 405. The hotel seems to have a similar standard of cleanliness to the flat, walls need a paint, rooms smell musty, but the sheets were clean and after very little sleep the night before that was a blessing. However the next morning I woke and after deciding not to shower in the flat was desperate for a wash, I opened the shower room door and was greeted by a huge cockroach. My partner who is an entomologist (so no chance of misidentifying it) caught it and I took it to reception as we checked out. The man on the desk looked at it laughed loudly and threw it in the bin, no apology was offered. I've travelled all over the world and I'm not a lily-livered traveller, but this has got to be one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Yes, itâ€™s fairly cheap, but there are other places to go, this is disgusting. I hate to think that people across the world are coming to this country and staying in a hovel like this and thinking that this is the standard that the British adhere to. It's not, please go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, everything I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: jacke
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveller to London and I have also lived in the city for four years, so one thing I know about London is how hard it is to find decent accommodation, both hotels and flats. In March 2007 I had to go two nights to London to attend a meeting and an interview. I wanted a cheap but good standard hotel where I could get some work done in the evening, where I could sleep properly to have enough energy for the work I had to do, and where I could fresh up in the morning without having to find ants or nasty stains in the bathroom. This may sound like basics, but there are some real dumps among the budget hotels in London. I booked Leisure Inn mostly based on the reviews here and the reasonable rates they offered, and I was positively surprised. The hotel was a 10-minute walk from Paddington station where you have access to four underground lines and the Heathrow Express going directly to Heathrow aiport (only 15 mins). Safe area with a few restaurants and corner shops within walking distance from the hotel. My room was small but adequate located on the fourth floor, it was very quiet and I was never bothered by the traffic or neighbouring guests. The bed was supposed to be a double bed, but honestly it was just slightly wider than my regular bed at home and the room must surely be on the smaller side if you are two people travelling together, the bed was very comfortable though. There was also a small desk with tea and coffee-making facilities, toilet and shower (in excellent condition), and a TV. I could only access three channels through the TV which was a disappointment, but I never complained about it. The breakfast was very simple with only toast, marmalade, cornflakes and milk, coffee/tea and orange juice. Something more would have been nice, at least some cold cuts. Staff on the whole friendly and courteous with the exception of one receptionist who was a bit surly The girl who checked me in was very pleasant, she recognised me throughout the stay and greeted me every time I passed the reception. Overall the hotel was everything I was looking for: cheap, safe, quiet, reasonable room standard and friendly staff. In just a few days I have to make another short trip to London and I have already booked a new stay at Leisure Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget break”
Reviews.Author: nifta
Reviews.Content: Booked this as part of a theatre package with lastminute at truly the last minute. I stayed by myself. It's in a great location (near Paddington and Hyde Park) and in a pretty pleasant area (lots of other hotels) away from busy roads. Was slightly unnerved by the need to leave a Â£30 cash deposit on check-in (in case of damages / thefts) and half expected to come back to the room to find the towels had "disappeared" and would lose the deposit Thankfully that was just my paranoia and I got the deposit back without any problem. The room (number 15) was in the basement but had a window. A good triple room. Furnished a bit like a travel lodge, i.e. modern and functional; no frills but clean. Nice bathroom. Comfy beds. Generally in a good state of repair. Lots of lighting options (spotlights / side lights). Very satisified! The only downside was the bedroom door was pretty thin / not well soundproofed so I was repeatedly woken from 6am by slamming doors from early risers / cleaning staff. I'm quite a heavy sleeper, so it was surprising. I dropped straight back off each time though. Breakfast was basic but fine (choice of cereals, followed by toast with cheese and jam selections. self service tea/coffee/juice.). Staff could be friendlier, but I was just on a weekend getaway (kicked out of the house whilst my fiance tried on wedding dresses with her bridesmaid) and I just needed a place to crash so didn't really care. The advertised room rate for the triple I had was Â£138, but I only paid Â£76 at lastminute *including* the theatre ticket. I think my review might be less favourable if I'd paid full price. It's a perfectly fine hotel, but not for Â£138 a night. Overall, no complaints. Not a place for a romantic getaway, but a good base to visit central London.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for London”
Reviews.Author: Debhog
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 20/03/2007. A basic hotel but clean and provided everything we needed. Room was pleasant and clean. Breakfast was basic in a bright, clean and cheerful room - cereal, toast, cheese, tea, coffee and orange juice but as we paid just Â£60.00 for the night in the centre of London I was quite happy and feel it is great value for money. Short walk from Paddington Station and Queensway underground. 24Hours reception. I would stay here again when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerless”
Reviews.Author: Meneph
Reviews.Content: My civil partner and I stayed at the Leisure Inn for 3 nights. We chose this hotel because it was cheap (37 pounds per night ensuite double room) and because of the reviews it got on this website. The room was OK. There was an awfull smell (like feet?) though when we came in. The TV had 5 channels, 4 of which were very blurred. The street is not too busy with cars, but it isn't too silent either. The rooms being equipped with single-glazing windows, there was still quite some noise most of the time, especially early in the mornings. I think it might get quite annoying in the summer when you want to keep your windows open. A real drawback was the fact that the shower would not work at peak-times. This is not a temporary problem, but due to the lack of water pressure. (We were on the 3rd floor. It might perhaps be different on the lower floors.) There will be no hot water available as long as other guests are having a shower and even late at night or in the afternoon it takes quite a while to get wet with a shower as week as this. Be warned: you should not take a shower when you are in a hurry because the hot water might turn off completely at times when other guests turn theirs on. And this could well be when you are all soaped up and ready to rinse. Breakfast: you get what you pay for - and that is not very much. The "buffet" has only got two kinds of cereals, milk, tiny cups for coffee or tea and one kind of (rather dry) sliced cheese. Orange juice is available, but there are not as many glasses as there are guests. The same is true for the space: you should be prepared to wait for a seat in the breakfast room. We were given 3 slices of toast (that's one and a half per person) and two or sometimes three tiny packs of jam and butter. We didn't ask for more because the staff was not very friendly at all. Having asked for a glass I felt like I was not really welcome at this hotel. One more thing: the hotel charged the first night before we even got there and the other two nights were to be paid for upon arrival before we even had a chance to see (or smell) our room. If we get to book this hotel for under 40 pounds per night again, we might return. If not, we'll try other places first.

HotelInfo.Name: Leisure Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 40-41 Leinster Gardens, London W2 3AN, England
